com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.argument

Class StringArgs

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.argument.StringArgs

  • @FullyTested
public final class StringArgs
extends Object
    Static methods to check String arguments.

    See ObjectArgs for an overview.

    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • checkNotEmpty

        @FullyTested
public static <T extends CharSequence> T checkNotEmpty(T ref,
                                                   String argName)
        Tests if a string reference is neither null nor empty, where empty is defined as 0 == ref.length().

        Examples that fail:

        • null
        • "" (empty)

        Examples that pass:

        • " " (whitespace)
        • "abc"
        • "大阪"
        Parameters:
        ref - a string reference
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Returns:
        the validated string reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if ref is empty
        See Also:
        ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkNotEmptyOrWhitespace(CharSequence, String)

      • checkNotEmptyOrWhitespace

        @FullyTested
public static <T extends CharSequence> T checkNotEmptyOrWhitespace(T ref,
                                                               String argName)
        Tests if a string reference is neither (a) null, (b) empty, nor (c) one or more whitespace chars.

        Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char), which includes all special whitespace chars used in East Asian languages.

        Examples that fail:

        • null
        • "" (empty)
        • " " (whitespace)

        Examples that pass:

        • "abc"
        • "大阪"
        Parameters:
        ref - a string reference
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Returns:
        the validated string reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if ref is empty or only whitespace
        See Also:
        ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkNotEmpty(CharSequence, String)

      • checkLengthRange

        @FullyTested
public static <T extends CharSequence> T checkLengthRange(T ref,
                                                      int minLen,
                                                      int maxLen,
                                                      String argName)
        Tests if a string reference is not null and its length within specified range. Length is defined as the number of characters in a CharSequence reference. Kindly remember that characters in East Asian languages are frequently two bytes.
        Parameters:
        ref - a string reference
        minLen - minimum number of chars (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        maxLen - maximum number of chars (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Returns:
        the validated string reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if minLen < 0
        • if maxLen < 0
        • if minLen > maxLen
        • if number of chars in ref is outside allowed range
        See Also:
        ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkNotEmpty(CharSequence, String), checkNotEmptyOrWhitespace(CharSequence, String), checkMinLength(CharSequence, int, String), checkMaxLength(CharSequence, int, String), checkExactLength(CharSequence, int, String)

      • checkMinLength

        @FullyTested
public static <T extends CharSequence> T checkMinLength(T ref,
                                                    int minLen,
                                                    String argName)
        Tests if a string reference is not null and has a minimum length. Length is defined as the number of characters in a CharSequence reference. Kindly remember that characters in East Asian languages are frequently two bytes.
        Parameters:
        ref - a string reference
        minLen - minimum number of chars (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Returns:
        the validated string reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if minLen < 0
        • if number of chars in ref is outside allowed range
        See Also:
        checkLengthRange(CharSequence, int, int, String)

      • checkMaxLength

        @FullyTested
public static <T extends CharSequence> T checkMaxLength(T ref,
                                                    int maxLen,
                                                    String argName)
        Tests if a string reference is not null and has a maximum length. Length is defined as the number of characters in a CharSequence reference. Kindly remember that characters in East Asian languages are frequently two bytes.
        Parameters:
        ref - a string reference
        maxLen - maximum number of chars (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Returns:
        the validated string reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if maxLen < 0
        • if number of chars in ref is outside allowed range
        See Also:
        checkLengthRange(CharSequence, int, int, String)

      • checkExactLength

        @FullyTested
public static <T extends CharSequence> T checkExactLength(T ref,
                                                      int exactLen,
                                                      String argName)
        Tests if a string reference is not null and has an exact length. Length is defined as the number of characters in a CharSequence reference. Kindly remember that characters in East Asian languages are frequently two bytes.
        Parameters:
        ref - a string reference
        exactLen - exact number of chars (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Returns:
        the validated string reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if exactLen < 0
        • if number of chars in ref is outside allowed range
        See Also:
        checkLengthRange(CharSequence, int, int, String)

      • checkInsertIndex

        @FullyTested
public static <T extends CharSequence> int checkInsertIndex(T ref,
                                                        int index,
                                                        String refArgName,
                                                        String indexArgName)
        Tests if a string reference is not null and an index is valid to insert an character.
        Parameters:
        ref - an string reference
        index - index of character to insert. Must be non-negative.
        refArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        indexArgName - argument name for index, e.g., "strListIndex"
        Returns:
        the validated index
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IndexOutOfBoundsException -
        • if index < 0
        • if index >= ref.length()

      • checkIndexAndCount

        @FullyTested
public static <T extends CharSequence> void checkIndexAndCount(T ref,
                                                           int index,
                                                           int count,
                                                           String refArgName,
                                                           String indexArgName,
                                                           String countArgName)
        Tests if an string reference is not null, and an index and count is valid to access characters.
        Parameters:
        ref - a string reference
        index - index of character to access. Must be non-negative.
        count - number of characters to access, starting from index. Must be non-negative.
        refArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        indexArgName - argument name for index, e.g., "strListIndex"
        countArgName - argument name for count, e.g., "strListCount"
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if ref is empty
        • if count < 0
        IndexOutOfBoundsException -
        • if index < 0
        • if index >= ref.length()
        • if index + count > ref.length()
